basics.name: Anthony Wonjoon Lee
basics.label: Shidler College of Business at the University of Hawai'i at Manoa
basics.summary: BBA Graduate in Management Information Systems, Minor in Computer Science

education.institution: Shidler College of Business - University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI
education.area: Management Information Systems, Minor in Computer Science
courses: Introduction to Computer Science I & II - Java
Software Engineering I - HTML/CSS, JavaScript, React, Meteor, MongoDB

work.summary: Summer 2023 Software Engineer Intern on the Intelligent Document Processing team
highlights: Collaborated with the AI/ML team to develop the Intelligent Document Processing Application, which utilized Azure Form Recognizers API to scan and extract data from insurance forms.
Implemented C# ASP.Net backend functionalities to handle data extraction, validation, and storage processes, ensuring efficient and accurate processing of insurance forms.
Conducted rigorous testing and debugging to identify and resolve software defects, improving the overall reliability and performance of the application using frameworks such as xUnit and Moq.
Contributed to the documentation of the application, including technical specifications, user manuals, and troubleshooting guides, facilitating future development and maintenance.
Technologies: C# ASP.Net, React.js, Azure

work.company: Research Computing Facility at the University of Hawaii at Manoa
highlights: Provided technical assistance to faculty and staff for all University-related computer and network systems, including hardware and software setup, troubleshooting, and repair
Coordinated with vendors and other IT staff to ensure efficient operation of university computers and networks.
Installed, configured, and maintained computer and network infrastructure such as workstations, servers, switches, routers, and firewalls
Technologies: Linux, Command Line, Windows
Successfully managed multiple solar projects simultaneously while coordinating with other departments, vendors, and clients.
Developed detailed project plans and schedules for each project, ensuring that all team members and vendors had adequate resources and deadlines for each task.
Provided hands-on support throughout the projectâ€™s life cycle, from design and pre-planning to installation and commissioning

organizations.organization: Delta Sigma Pi Business Fraternity - Rho Chi Chapter
organizations.position: President, Vice President of New Member Education, Vice President of Professional Activities
highlights: Facilitated meetings and guided leadership of more than 70 active collegiate members and 300 alumni
Developed and maintained relationships with corporate partners to secure resources for professional and educational development
Established initiatives to support student members in developing professional and networking skills, leading to an over 70% internship landing rate of upperclassmen members
Managed a budget of $10,000 and ensured all funds were allocated in accordance with club policies and procedures

organizations.organization: Kappa Sigma Fraternity - Omicron Zeta Chapter
organizations.position: Vice President, Scholarship Chair, Risk Management Chair
highlights: Served as Vice President of Kappa Sigma Fraternity, overseeing operations, scholarship, and event planning
Spearheaded efforts to increase membership by 30%, resulting in increased funding and publicity for the organization
Implemented a Diversity-Inclusion-Equity program, the first of its kind for any Greek Fraternity organization at the University
Established and maintained strong relationships with university staff and alumni to ensure that the organization met expectations and standards

organizations.organization: University of Hawaii eSports - Valorant Varsity Black
highlights: Assumed the role of captain of the University of Hawaii's Valorant eSports team, creating strategies to ensure the team's success
Leveraged in-depth knowledge of the game and its players to create team compositions and winning tactics
Coordinated regular practice sessions and team meetings to foster cooperation, trust, and mutual respect

awards.title: Hawai'i State Seal of Biliteracy: Korean and English
awards.awarder: State of Hawaii Department of Education
awards.summary: Awarded to those who pass a biliteracy test to acknowledge reading, writing, and speaking skills in multiple languages.
